definition: 100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together
variant of 合伙人[he2 huo3 ren2]

sentences.english: Zhoubo, obtained his LLB degree from East China University of Politics and Law , is the senior partner of Shanghai Wintell Law Firm.
sentences.chinese: 華東政法大學法學學士，上海瀛泰律師事務所合夥人。

sentences.english: Managing Director and Partner, AsiaTech Management LLC.
sentences.chinese: 董事總經理，合夥人，治平投資。

sentences.english: The cause stipulated in the partnership agreement arises.
sentences.chinese: 發生合夥協議約定的事由。

sentences.english: I have the pleasure to inform you that I have entered into partnership with Mr. K. Kono.
sentences.chinese: 本人已與河野謙吉先生合夥營業，特此奉告。

sentences.english: Instead of it, he established a company with a partner.
sentences.chinese: 代而替之的，是他與一個合夥人建立了一個公司。

sentences.english: They have been yoked together in business since the end of the eighties.
sentences.chinese: 80年代末以來，他們一直合夥做生意。

sentences.english: Avoid  alternative investments and private partnerships that might be hard to sell.
sentences.chinese: 不要做可能難於脫手的另類投資或私人合夥投資。

sentences.english: People began arriving at my ex-partner’s house almost immediately.
sentences.chinese: 人們幾乎立刻開始來到我以前合夥人的房子。

sentences.english: The United States is the birthplace of co-working space.
sentences.chinese: 美國是是合夥辦公空間的創始地。

sentences.english: The two partners split after a quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個合夥人吵了一架之後分成道揚鑣了。

sentences.english: Sham tax shelters sold by large accounting firms to partner companies.
sentences.chinese: 被大會計公司賣與公司合夥的假稅庇護所。

sentences.english: He was a partner in a firm of solicitors in Holborn.
sentences.chinese: 他是荷爾本一家律師事務所的合夥人。

sentences.english: Aldisert is a partner at the law firm Kwika, in Santa Monica.
sentences.chinese: 他是聖莫尼卡的Kwika律師事務所合夥人。

sentences.english: A partnership enterprise shall hand in the business license when going through the formalities of nullification of registration.
sentences.chinese: 合夥企業辦理註銷登記時，應當繳回營業執照。

sentences.english: The two of them bought a second-hand car between them.
sentences.chinese: 他們兩私合夥買了一輛二手車。

sentences.english: For firms in search of capital and a low-key partner, CIC isappealing.
sentences.chinese: 對於尋找資金和低調合夥人的公司，中投很有吸引力。

definition: variant of 合伙人[he2 huo3 ren2]
to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
lit. knifes piercing both sides (idiom)/fig. to attach a great importance to friendship, up to the point of being able to sacrifice oneself for it
to act arbitrarily/to make decisions without consulting others
